thread.title: Red Wings ship Dan Cleary, Xavier Ouellet to minors
thread.title_full: Red Wings ship Dan Cleary, Xavier Ouellet to minors

title: Red Wings ship Dan Cleary, Xavier Ouellet to minors
text:
Red Wings ship Dan Cleary, Xavier Ouellet to minors 
The Sports Xchange Thursday, October 08, 2015 05:06 PM EDT | Updated: Thursday, October 08, 2015 05:10 PM EDT Vancouver Canucks goalie Cory Schneider stops Detroit Red Wings forward Dan Cleary during their NHL game in Vancouver April 20, 2013. (REUTERS/Andy Clark) NHLers made headlines for wrong reasons in off-season 
The Detroit Red Wings sent veteran right winger Dan Cleary and defenseman Xavier Ouellet to Grand Rapids of the American Hockey League on Thursday and took defensemen Jakub Kindl and Alexey Marchenko off injured reserve. 
The 35-year-old Cleary cleared waivers after being cut by the Red Wings on Wednesday. He played in just 17 games last season and had two points after seeing action in 52 games the year before that and posting eight points. In four exhibition games this year, he had two points. 
In 11 seasons with the Red Wings, Cleary has played in 609 games and totaled 275 points. His NHL career totals include 387 points in 938 games. 
Cleary had signed a one-year, one-way contract worth $950,000 with the Red Wings in early September. 
The 22-year-old Ouellet split time between Grand Rapids and Detroit last season. He had three points in 21 games for the Red Wings and 16 points in 52 games for Grand Rapids. 
The Red Wings open the regular season on Friday night at home against the Toronto Maple Leafs. Sponsored Links
